Class GaussianKernelFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • GaussianKernelFactory

  • public final class GaussianKernelFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Generates Gaussian kernels, per the formulas on https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gaussian_function Provides 1D, 2D, and 3D generation methods. This is a pseudo-static class (should not be instantiated).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double[] get1D(double theta, int size)
      Creates a one-dimensional gaussian kernel with a given theta and size.

      Creates a two-dimensional gaussian kernel with a given theta and size.

      Creates a three-dimensional gaussian kernel with a given theta and size.
      static float[][][] get3DFloat(double theta, int size)
      Creates a three-dimensional gaussian kernel with a given theta and size.
      static float[][][] get3DFloat(double theta, int w, int h, int d)
      Creates a three-dimensional gaussian kernel with a given theta and width, height, depth.
      static double getDiscrete1D(double theta, int x)
      Calculate a discrete value of a single point in a 1D distribution.
      static double getDiscrete2D(double theta, int x, int y)
      Calculate a discrete value of a single point in a 2D distribution.
      static double getDiscrete3D(double theta, int x, int y, int z)
      Calculate a discrete value of a single point in a 3D distribution.

    • Method Detail

      • get1D

        public static double[] get1D(double theta,
                             int size)
        Creates a one-dimensional gaussian kernel with a given theta and size.
        Parameters:
        theta - The theta value for the gaussian distribution
        size - The length of the kernel. Should be an odd number > 1.
        Returns:
        An array containing the calculated kernel.

      • get2D

        public static double[][] get2D(double theta,
                               int size)
        Creates a two-dimensional gaussian kernel with a given theta and size.
        Parameters:
        theta - The theta value for the gaussian distribution
        size - The square size of the kernel. Should be an odd number > 1.
        Returns:
        An array containing the calculated kernel.

      • get3D

        public static double[][][] get3D(double theta,
                                 int size)
        Creates a three-dimensional gaussian kernel with a given theta and size.
        Parameters:
        theta - The theta value for the gaussian distribution
        size - The cubic size of the kernel. Should be an odd number > 1.
        Returns:
        An array containing the calculated kernel.

      • get3DFloat

        public static float[][][] get3DFloat(double theta,
                                     int size)
        Creates a three-dimensional gaussian kernel with a given theta and size. Returns data as floats
        Parameters:
        theta - The theta value for the gaussian distribution
        size - The cubic size of the kernel. Should be an odd number > 1.
        Returns:
        An array containing the calculated kernel.

      • get3DFloat

        public static float[][][] get3DFloat(double theta,
                                     int w,
                                     int h,
                                     int d)
        Creates a three-dimensional gaussian kernel with a given theta and width, height, depth. Returns data as floats.
        Parameters:
        theta - The theta value for the guassian distribution
        w - The width of the kernel (primary dimension). Should be an odd number > 1.
        h - The width of the kernel (secondary dimension). Should be an odd number > 1.
        d - The width of the kernel (tertiary dimension). Should be an odd number > 1.
        Returns:
        An array containing the calculated kernel.

      • getDiscrete1D

        public static double getDiscrete1D(double theta,
                                   int x)
        Calculate a discrete value of a single point in a 1D distribution.
        Parameters:
        theta - The theta value for the gaussian distribution
        x - The point at which to calculate a discrete value.
        Returns:
        The discrete gaussian value

      • getDiscrete2D

        public static double getDiscrete2D(double theta,
                                   int x,
                                   int y)
        Calculate a discrete value of a single point in a 2D distribution.
        Parameters:
        theta - The theta value for the gaussian distribution
        x - The x coordinate of the discrete value.
        y - The y coordinate of the discrete value.
        Returns:
        The discrete gaussian value

      • getDiscrete3D

        public static double getDiscrete3D(double theta,
                                   int x,
                                   int y,
                                   int z)
        Calculate a discrete value of a single point in a 3D distribution.
        Parameters:
        theta - The theta value for the gaussian distribution
        x - The x coordinate of the discrete value.
        y - The y coordinate of the discrete value.
        z - The z coordinate of the discrete value.
        Returns:
        The discrete gaussian value
